 Islamic Terrorism must be stopped by whatever means necessary! The 
courts must give us back our protective rights. Have to be tough!”
analysis:
The
 judicial system is an equal branch of government, intended by the 
framers to be a check on the executive and legislative branches.

text:
“I
 am supportive of Lamar as a person & also of the process, but I can
 never support bailing out ins co's who have made a fortune w/ O'Care.”
analysis:
This
 claim is false. Insurance companies have actually lost billions in the 
Obamacare exchanges, according to company filings and industry analysts.
 For example, Aetna is on pace to lose $750 million from its 
participation in the exchanges — $100 million in 2014, $150 million in 
2015, $300 million in 2016 and more than $200 million in 2017. As a 
result, it is not participating in 2018, a spokesman said. Humana 
announced it would leave the exchanges, saying it was too risky after 
losing $45 million in the individual market in 2017.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“My
 statement as to what's happening in Sweden was in reference to a story 
that was broadcast on @FoxNews concerning immigrants & Sweden.”
analysis:
Trump
 referred to rising crime rates in Sweden, but the country's overall 
rate has fallen in recent years. Sweden has welcomed refugees and 
immigrants, but Swedish crime experts do not agree that the country's 
immigration policies are linked to crime.

text:
“Despite
 major outside money, FAKE media support and eleven Republican 
candidates, BIG "R" win with runoff in Georgia. Glad to be of help!”
analysis:
Trump
 took credit for the upcoming runoff election in Georgia's 6th 
Congressional District, even though Republicans in the race distanced 
themselves from Trump as the election got closer. While the Republicans 
avoided an embarrassing loss, it wasn't exactly a BIG "R" win that 
Republican Karen Handel will face Democrat Jon Ossoff in the runoff.

text: “#BuyAmericanHireAmerican”
analysis:
Trump
 now calls for Americans to “buy American, hire American.” But this is 
misleading. Trump has a long history of outsourcing a variety of his own
 products. The Fact Checker has counted a total of 12 countries where 
Trump products were manufactured (China, the Netherlands, Mexico, India,
 Turkey, Slovenia, Honduras, Germany, Bangladesh, Indonesia, Vietnam and
 South Korea).

text:
“Big
 day tomorrow in Georgia and South Carolina. ObamaCare is dead. Dems 
want to raise taxes big! They can only obstruct, no ideas. Vote 'R'”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not "dead" and is expected to remain stable for 
the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

text:
“The
 Dems want to stop tax cuts, good healthcare and Border Security.Their 
ObamaCare is dead with 100% increases in P's. Vote now for Karen H”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not "dead" and is expected to remain stable for 
the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office. He
 appears to be referring to increases in premiums ("P's") but 
cherry-picks increases from the higher end of premium spikes. Most 
people on the exchanges receive tax credits that offset the increases.

text:
“The
 Republicans never discuss how good their healthcare bill is, & it 
will get even better at lunchtime.The Dems scream death as OCare dies!”
analysis: The Affordable Care Act is expected to remain stable for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

text:
“The
 Fake News is going crazy with wacky Congresswoman Wilson(D), who was 
SECRETLY on a very personal call, and gave a total lie on content!”
analysis:
Wilson
 was an invited guest on the speakerphone condolence call between Trump 
and Myeshia Johnson, the widow of Sgt. La David Johnson, a soldier 
killed in Niger. Moreover, it turned out she did not lie, as her 
description of Trump's awkward phrasing was confirmed by White House 
chief of staff John Kelly.

text: “Workers of firm involved with the discredited and Fake Dossier take the 5th.”
analysis:
While
 the dossier commissioned by Fusion GPS for Democrats contained 
salacious elements, broad portions have proven to be largely correct.

text:
“Give
 the public a break - The FAKE NEWS media is trying to say that large 
scale immigration in Sweden is working out just beautifully. NOT!”
analysis:
Trump
 referred to rising crime rates in Sweden, but the country's overall 
rate has fallen in recent years. Sweden has welcomed refugees and 
immigrants, but Swedish crime experts do not agree that the country's 
immigration policies are linked to crime.

text:
“James
 Clapper and others stated that there is no evidence Potus colluded with
 Russia. This story is FAKE NEWS and everyone knows it!”
analysis:
Intelligence
 officials have not focused on Trump's possible involvement in Russian 
efforts to sway the election but on associates of Trump and people 
involved in the campaign. Fact Checker rating:

text:
“The
 Democrats made up and pushed the Russian story as an excuse for running
 a terrible campaign. Big advantage in Electoral College & lost!”
analysis:
The
 information on Russian efforts to sway the 2016 election was developed 
by the intelligence community and published in a declassified report, in
 which the agencies said they had "high confidence" it was correct. Fact Checker rating:

text: “The NSA and FBI tell Congress that Russia did not influence electoral process.”
analysis:
This
 was a strange claim, especially because if you watch the video, 
National Security Agency director Rogers makes clear that, when asked 
about whether Russian cyber-actors changed vote tallies in Michigan and 
other states, he replied: “I would highlight we are a foreign 
intelligence organization, not a domestic intelligence organization. So 
it would be fair to say, we are probably not the best organization to 
provide a more complete answer.” Indeed, when later asked about the 
presidential tweet, FBI director James Comey said it did not reflect 
what he and Rogers had said: “It certainly wasn’t our intention to say 
that today.”Fact Checker rating:

text: “FBI Director Comey: fmr. DNI Clapper 'right' to say no evidence of collusion between Russia and Trump Campaign.”
analysis:
This
 was false. Comey was specifically talking about the Jan. 6 document 
issued by the intelligence agencies — a document that the Trump White 
House has largely ignored, except to suggest it was fake. Former 
director of national intelligence James Clapper later issued a statement
 saying it was “in the best interest of all Americans” to investigate 
possible Trump-Russia ties.Fact Checker rating:

text: “FBI Director Comey refuses to deny he briefed President Obama on calls made by Michael Flynn to Russia.”
analysis:
Comey
 was very careful not to discuss individuals, such as fired national 
security adviser Michael Flynn. He noted that the listeners were not to 
draw any unwarranted conclusions from his refusal to comment. But 
apparently his warning fell on deaf ears at the White House.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Democrat
 Jon Ossoff, who wants to raise your taxes to the highest level and is 
weak on crime and security, doesn't even live in district.”
analysis:
Jon
 Ossoff, the Democrat Trump is referring to, supports a comprehensive 
immigration bill that allows a "path to legal status" for undocumented 
people (excluding felons) living in the country. But he also said he 
supports strong border security. As PolitiFact found, this is not the 
same as "allowing illegal immigration." On taxes, factcheck.org found 
that Ossoff has proposed to simplify the tax code, and that “in order to
 lower tax rates, we can eliminate carve-outs and special treatment in 
the tax code that privilege large organizations at the expense of small 
businesses.” Trump is correct that Ossoff did not live in the 
congressional district.

text:
“I
 would not sign Graham-Cassidy if it did not include coverage of 
pre-existing conditions. It does! A great Bill. Repeal & Replace.”
analysis:
This
 is misleading. Depending on the state, the protection for preexisting 
conditions could be the same under Graham-Cassidy — or people with 
cancer or other serious illnesses could find themselves in a high-risk 
pool being charged extraordinarily high premiums.

text:
“Just
 out report: 'United Kingdom crime rises 13% annually amid spread of 
Radical Islamic terror.' Not good, we must keep America safe!”
analysis:
This
 tweet caused anger in the United Kingdom, as the statistic is fiction. 
The report cited by Trump barely mentioned terrorism.

text: “The budget passed late last night, 51 to 49.”
analysis:
Trump
 is referring to the nonbinding budget resolution which does not require
 a presidential signature. It's not really a budget.

text:
“No
 matter how much I accomplish during the ridiculous standard of the 
first 100 days, & it has been a lot (including S.C.), media will 
kill!”
analysis:
Trump
 calls the 100-day mark a ridiculous standard but before the election he
 grandly announced a 100-day he titled the "Contract with the American 
Voter." Few of the promises made in that documents have been kept in 
Trump's first 100 days.

text:
“Democrats
 would do much better as a party if they got together with Republicans 
on Healthcare,Tax Cuts,Security. Obstruction doesn't work!”
analysis: Trump has not reached out to Democrats on these issues, and often has inflamed tensions with nasty, personal tweets.

text:
“Well,
 the Special Elections are over and those that want to MAKE AMERICA 
GREAT AGAIN are 5 and O! All the Fake News, all the money spent = 0”
analysis: Actually, Republicans won four special elections and Democrats won one.

text:
“Senator
 Luther Strange has gone up a lot in the polls since I endorsed him a 
month ago. Now a close runoff. He will be great in D.C.”
analysis: Polling does not support Trump's claim that Luther Strange's chances improved after Trump's endorsement, {PolitiFact found.}

text:
“Keep
 hearing about 'tiny' amount of money spent on Facebook ads. What about 
the billions of dollars of Fake News on CNN, ABC, NBC & CBS?”
analysis:
Trump
 received $5.6 billion of free media during the 2016 presidential 
campaign, more than Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, Ted Cruz, Paul Ryan
 and Marco Rubio combined, according to data from tracking firm 
mediaQuant.

text: “Lowest unemployment in 17 yrs!”
analysis:
Trump
 now uses data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics unemployment rate to 
say this, which is a flip-flop from his previous claims dismissing the 
BLS unemployment rate as "nonsense."

text:
“Had
 a great meeting at CIA Headquarters yesterday, packed house, paid great
 respect to Wall, long standing ovations, amazing people. WIN!”
analysis:
Trump
 appeared to be responding to criticism of his heavily political speech 
in front of the CIA’s memorial wall. He claimed to have received 
standing ovations, but he never invited the employees to take a seat. So
 they remained standing the whole time.

text:
“Wow,
 television ratings just out: 31 million people watched the 
Inauguration, 11 million more than the very good ratings from 4 years 
ago!”
analysis:
Actually,
 Obama’s ratings in 2009 were 7 million people higher than Trump’s 
numbers. Second-term inaugurals tend to get lower ratings, so Trump is 
cherry-picking the comparison.

text:
“Why
 did the DNC REFUSE to turn over its Server to the FBI, and still 
hasn't? It's all a big Dem scam and excuse for losing the election!”
analysis:
The
 DNC did refuse to give direct access to the FBI, but allowed a 
third-party company to gather information on behalf of the FBI. Former 
FBI director James Comey told Congress FBI technicians got all the 
information they needed without requiring possession of the server.

text:
“Why
 did Democratic National Committee turn down the DHS offer to protect 
against hacks (long prior to election). It's all a big Dem HOAX!”
analysis:
Trump
 is falsely labeling nonpartisan investigations as made up by Democrats.
 The CIA concluded in 2016 that Russia intervened in the U.S. 
presidential election to help elect Trump, an assessment backed up by 
FBI Director James B. Comey and then-Director of National Intelligence 
James R. Clapper Jr. On Jan. 6, the intelligence community released a 
declassified report expressing "high confidence" in this judgement. 
Senate and House committees led by Republicans have begun their own 
investigations, and a special prosecutor has been appointed.

text:
“By
 the way, if Russia was working so hard on the 2016 Election, it all 
took place during the Obama Admin. Why didn't they stop them?”
analysis:
Trump
 suggests Russian interference in the 2016 is still open to question, 
but the three key U.S. intelligence agencies have agreed that Russia did
 seek to manpulate the election results on the instructions of Russian 
president Vladimir Putin.

text:
“Former
 Homeland Security Advisor Jeh Johnson is latest top intelligence 
official to state there was no grand scheme between Trump & Russia.”
analysis:
Trump
 twists Johnson's {words out of context}. Johnson said in a testimony 
before the House Intelligence Committee that he was not aware of any 
additional information tha what was publicly reported.

text: “As promised, our campaign against the MS-13 gang continues. '@ICEgov Busts 39 MS-13 Members in New York Operation"'”
analysis:
Trump
 is indeed ramping up enforcement actions against MS-13, but enforcement
 action so far is a continuation of Operation Community Shield, which 
has been going on since 2005. While a recent six-week raid was the 
biggest raid to date against MS-13 members and associates, there's not 
been a significant change in deportations yet that Trump promised on the
 campaign.

text: “I am very supportive of the Senate #HealthcareBill. Look forward to making it really special! Remember, ObamaCare is dead.”
analysis: The Affordable Care Act is expected to remain stable for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

text:
“The
 Failing New York Times foiled U.S. attempt to kill the single most 
wanted terrorist,Al-Baghdadi.Their sick agenda over National Security”
analysis: The Times reported off of information that was released by the Pentagon {more than three weeks} before the article ran.

text:
“While
 all agree the U. S. President has the complete power to pardon, why 
think of that when only crime so far is LEAKS against us.FAKE NEWS”
analysis:
There
 are limits to the president's power to pardon. And legal experts 
dispute whether the president can pardon himself, which was a question 
his legal team was exploring at the time of this tweet.

text:
“...What
 about all of the Clinton ties to Russia, including Podesta Company, 
Uranium deal, Russian Reset, big dollar speeches etc.”
analysis:
Trump
 suggests the State Department under Hillary Clinton had sole approval 
authority on a uranium rights deal with a company largely owned by 
Russia’s nuclear energy agency. But the State Department is one of nine 
agencies in the Committee on Foreign Investments in the United States to
 vet and sign off on all U.S. transactions involving foreign 
governments. There is no evidence Clinton herself got involved in the 
deal personally, and it is highly questionable that this deal even rose 
to the level of the secretary of state. The Nuclear Regulatory 
Commission also needed to approve, and did approve, the transfer.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“My
 son Donald openly gave his e-mails to the media & authorities 
whereas Crooked Hillary Clinton deleted (& acid washed) her 33,000 
e-mails!”
analysis: Donald Trump Jr. only released the emails facing a pending report on the content of the emails by the New York Times.

text:
“ObamaCare
 is dead and the Democrats are obstructionists, no ideas or votes, only 
obstruction. It is solely up to the 52 Republican Senators!”
analysis: The Affordable Care Act is expected to remain stable for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

text:
“The
 Russia hoax continues, now it's ads on Facebook. What about the totally
 biased and dishonest Media coverage in favor of Crooked Hillary?”
analysis:
The
 information on Russian efforts to sway the 2016 election was developed 
by the intelligence community and published in a declassified report, in
 which the agencies said they had "high confidence" it was correct.

text:
“Will
 be in Alabama tonight. Luther Strange has gained mightily since my 
endorsement, but will be very close. He loves Alabama, and so do I!”
analysis: Polling does not support Trump's claim that Luther Strange's chances improved after Trump's endorsement, {PolitiFact found.}

text:
“The
 two fake news polls released yesterday, ABC & NBC, while containing
 some very positive info, were totally wrong in General E. Watch!”
analysis:
Trump
 is wrong about how he characterizes these polls. Both the final 
Post-ABC poll (47-43) and NBC/WSJ poll (44-40) had Clinton ahead by four
 points; both outlets emphasized the four-way result, but also tested 
preferences excluding third-party candidates that showed +3 for Post-ABC
 and +5 for NBC/WSJ. Clinton won the national popular vote by 2.1 
points. This level of error is quite good for national pre-election 
polls in the United States.

text:
“New
 polls out today are very good considering that much of the media is 
FAKE and almost always negative. Would still beat Hillary in 
........popular vote. ABC News/Washington Post Poll (wrong big on 
election) said almost all stand by their vote on me & 53% said 
strong leader.”
analysis:
The
 final Post-ABC pre-election poll showed Clinton winning the popular 
vote by three percentage points in a head-to-head match-up. She won by 
2.1 percentage points. Trump also falsely suggests he won the popular 
vote when in fact he lost it.

text:
“ObamaCare
 is in serious trouble. The Dems need big money to keep it going - 
otherwise it dies far sooner than anyone would have thought.”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not imploding and is expected to remain stable 
for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget 
Office.

text:
“The
 Democrats don't want money from budget going to border wall despite the
 fact that it will stop drugs and very bad MS 13 gang members.”
analysis:
Trump’s
 claim that the wall would halt the flow of drugs is dubious. Experts 
say that drugs are actually shipped through the border on the underside 
of vehicles that have permits to cross the border in a special lane.

text:
“The
 Wall is a very important tool in stopping drugs from pouring into our 
country and poisoning our youth (and many others)! If the wall is not 
built, which it will be, the drug situation will NEVER be fixed the way 
it should be!”
analysis:
Trump’s
 claim that the wall would halt the flow of drugs is dubious. Experts 
say that drugs are actually shipped through the border on the underside 
of vehicles that have permits to cross the border in a special lane.

text:
“I've
 helped pass and signed 38 Legislative Bills, mostly with no Democratic 
support, and gotten rid of massive amounts of regulations. Nice!”
analysis:
As
 of June 27, the president has signed 42 pieces of legislation but it is
 tough categorize them as "really big." Many work toward deregulation 
and dismantling Obamacare.

text:
“As
 the phony Russian Witch Hunt continues, two groups are laughing at this
 excuse for a lost election taking hold, Democrats and Russians!”
analysis:
The
 information on Russian efforts to sway the 2016 election was developed 
by the intelligence community and published in a declassified report, in
 which the agencies said they had "high confidence" it was correct.

text:
“Arizona
 had a 116% increase in ObamaCare premiums last year, with deductibles 
very high. Chuck Schumer sold John McCain a bill of goods. Sad”
analysis:
This
 is one of Trump’s favorite talking points on Obamacare, yet it’s still 
misleading. For 2017, the average increase in premiums before subsidies 
was 25 percent, so he is cherry-picking the highest end of premium 
increases. Moreover, Trump using data from the Department of Health and 
Human Services that do not take into account the effect of subsidies, 
which shield 84 percent of people in the exchanges from such extreme 
premium hikes. On average, eight out of 10 marketplace enrollees receive
 government premium subsidies, and they are protected from a premium 
increase (and may even see a decrease) if they stay with a low-cost 
plan.

text:
“Alaska
 had a 200% plus increase in premiums under ObamaCare, worst in the 
country. Deductibles high, people angry! Lisa M comes through.”
analysis:
This
 is one of Trump’s favorite talking points on Obamacare, yet it’s still 
misleading. For 2017, the average increase in premiums before subsidies 
was 25 percent, so he is cherry-picking the highest end of premium 
increases. Moreover, Trump using data from the Department of Health and 
Human Services that do not take into account the effect of subsidies, 
which shield 84 percent of people in the exchanges from such extreme 
premium hikes. On average, eight out of 10 marketplace enrollees receive
 government premium subsidies, and they are protected from a premium 
increase (and may even see a decrease) if they stay with a low-cost 
plan.

text:
“Democrats
 are laughingly saying that McCain had a "moment of courage." Tell that 
to the people of Arizona who were deceived. 116% increase!”
analysis:
This
 is one of Trump’s favorite talking points on Obamacare, yet it’s still 
misleading. For 2017, the average increase in premiums before subsidies 
was 25 percent, so he is cherry-picking the highest end of premium 
increases. Moreover, Trump using data from the Department of Health and 
Human Services that do not take into account the effect of subsidies, 
which shield 84 percent of people in the exchanges from such extreme 
premium hikes. On average, eight out of 10 marketplace enrollees receive
 government premium subsidies, and they are protected from a premium 
increase (and may even see a decrease) if they stay with a low-cost 
plan.

text:
“If
 Chicago doesn’t fix the horrible ‘carnage’ going on, 228 shootings in 
2017 with 42 killings (up 24% from 2016), I will send in the Feds!”
analysis:
The
 percentage is accurate, per Chicago police. But with only one month of 
data in 2017, it’s too early to use that statistic to call it “carnage.”
 Trump also said he would “send in the feds,” although federal agencies 
already work with Chicago police.

text:
“Today,
 I was thrilled to announce a commitment of $25 BILLION & 20K 
AMERICAN JOBS over the next 4 years. THANK YOU Charter Communications!”
analysis:
Trump
 trumpeted the company’s announcement that it would invest $25 billion 
in the United States and hire 20,000 workers over four years, but the 
company’s jobs plan was in the works as early as June 2015.

text:
“If
 our healthcare plan is approved, you will see real healthcare and 
premiums will start tumbling down. ObamaCare is in a death spiral!”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not imploding and is expected to remain stable 
for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget 
Office.

text:
“Democrats
 slam GOP healthcare proposal as Obamacare premiums & deductibles 
increase by over 100%. Remember keep your doctor, keep your plan?”
analysis:
Premium
 increases range from single digits in certain states to upwards of 100 
percent in others, so Trump is using the higher end of the range. 
Moreover, he uses the calculation of premium increases without 
incorporating the impact of tax credits — which most people in the 
exchanges receive. If you take the subsidies into account, the average 
monthly premium of most people in the individual market exchange goes 
down, not up

text:
“The
 Amazon Washington Post fabricated the facts on my ending massive, 
dangerous, and wasteful payments to Syrian rebels fighting Assad.....”
analysis:
The
 Washington Post is owned by Jeffrey P. Bezos, the founder of Amazon. 
Amazon does not own The Post, but in any case the president’s claims 
about “no-tax” Amazon are out of date. Amazon used to lobby to keep 
Internet sales free from state taxes, but no more. {As of March,} Amazon
 is collecting sales tax on purchases in every state that has one.

text:
“So
 many stories about me in the @washingtonpost are Fake News. They are as
 bad as ratings challenged @CNN. Lobbyist for Amazon and taxes?”
analysis:
The
 Washington Post is owned by Jeffrey P. Bezos, the founder of Amazon. 
Amazon does not own The Post, but in any case the president’s claims 
about “no-tax” Amazon are out of date. Amazon used to lobby to keep 
Internet sales free from state taxes, but no more. {As of March,} Amazon
 is collecting sales tax on purchases in every state that has one.

text:
“Is
 Fake News Washington Post being used as a lobbyist weapon against 
Congress to keep Politicians from looking into Amazon no-tax monopoly?”
analysis:
The
 Washington Post is owned by Jeffrey P. Bezos, the founder of Amazon. 
Amazon does not own The Post, but in any case the president’s claims 
about “no-tax” Amazon are out of date. Amazon used to lobby to keep 
Internet sales free from state taxes, but no more. {As of March,} Amazon
 is collecting sales tax on purchases in every state that has one.

text:
“...NFL
 attendance and ratings are WAY DOWN. Boring games yes, but many stay 
away because they love our country. League should back U.S.”
analysis:
This
 lacks context. The TV audience size for NFL games is down this year, 
but it’s unclear exactly why, and there is no direct connection to the 
protests. “Average attendance at regular season NFL games last year was 
the highest since 2007, when the NFL set an all-time record in 
attendance. The NFL says ticket sales are “on par” with last year,” 
according to the {Associated Press.} And professional football games 
remain among the most-watched televised events, the AP reported.

text:
“Great
 solidarity for our National Anthem and for our Country. Standing with 
locked arms is good, kneeling is not acceptable. Bad ratings!”
analysis:
This
 lacks context. The TV audience size for NFL games is down this year, 
but it’s unclear exactly why, and there's no direct connection to the 
protests. “Average attendance at regular season NFL games last year was 
the highest since 2007, when the NFL set an all-time record in 
attendance. The NFL says ticket sales are “on par” with last year,” 
according to the {Associated Press.} And professional football games 
remain among the most-watched televised events, the AP reported.

text: “Alaska, Arizona, Maine and Kentucky are big winners in the Healthcare proposal.”
analysis: All would have lost federal funding.

text:
“The
 media has not reported that the National Debt in my first month went 
down by $12 billion vs a $200 billion increase in Obama first mo.”
analysis:
Trump
 is citing such a narrow window of time that the statistics he’s 
pointing to don’t mean very much. The level of debt fluctuates day to 
day and week to week, depending on seasonal changes in growth and when 
the government makes payments, collects tax revenue, issues new debt and
 other debt matures — making the data very susceptible to 
cherry-picking. Using the same logic, you could claim that after four 
days in office Trump increased outstanding public debt by more than $10 
billion, and that Obama had reduced it by $6 billion.

text: “ObamaCare will explode and we will all get together and piece together a great healthcare plan for THE PEOPLE. Do not worry!”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not exploding and is expected to remain stable 
for the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget 
Office.

text:
“Don't
 let the fake media tell you that I have changed my position on the 
WALL. It will get built and help stop drugs, human trafficking etc.”
analysis:
There
 is little evidence that human trafficking takes place over the 
U.S.-Mexican border. While human trafficking is a problem in some parts 
of the world, experts say it is relatively limited in the United States,
 especially for sexual exploitation. But in general data is limited on 
the extent of human trafficking.

text:
“Hillary
 Clinton colluded with the Democratic Party in order to beat Crazy 
Bernie Sanders. Is she allowed to so collude? Unfair to Bernie!”
analysis:
Trump's
 use of 'collude' suggests that DNC conspired to hurt the Sanders 
campaign. {Despite the DNC email hack which showed the committee 
strongly preferred Clinton,} there's no evidence that Clinton conspired 
with the committee to damage the Sanders campaign.

text:
“Ukrainian
 efforts to sabotage Trump campaign - 'quietly working to boost 
Clinton.' So where is the investigation A.G. @seanhannity”
analysis:
Trump
 is referring to efforts by a Ukrainian American operative to expose 
former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort’s ties to the Russian 
government. But the comparison to the Russian probe is overblown and 
facile, making a similar criminal probe problematic.

text:
“Attorney
 General Jeff Sessions has taken a VERY weak position on Hillary Clinton
 crimes (where are E-mails & DNC server) & Intel leakers!”
analysis:
Trump
 {conflates a number of issues here} in his continuing effort to force 
his attorney general from office because of his anger that Sessions 
followed Justice Department guidance and recused himself from the Russia
 probe.

text:
“Problem
 is that the acting head of the FBI & the person in charge of the 
Hillary investigation, Andrew McCabe, got $700,000 from H for wife!”
analysis:
Andrew
 McCabe, who is now the acting FBI director, became part of the 
investigation of Hillary Clinton’s emails long after his wife, Jill 
McCabe, unsuccessfully ran for a Virginia Senate seat. The political 
action committee of Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe (D) gave $452,500 to 
McCabe, and the state Democratic Party gave her campaign an additional 
$207,788. That was about one-third of the $1.8 million budget for her 
campaign. McAuliffe is close to Clinton, but there is no evidence she 
knew of the contributions. Moreover, it stretches the imagination that 
McAuliffe would know that the husband of someone he was supporting in a 
Virginia legislative race was going to be promoted months later to a 
position of authority in the email case.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Jared
 Kushner did very well yesterday in proving he did not collude with the 
Russians. Witch Hunt. Next up, 11 year old Barron Trump!”
analysis:
Kushner,
 the president’s son-in-law, gave a lengthy statement explaining his 
side of the story and denying any collusion. That is not Kushner 
“proving he did not collude with the Russians”; the special counsel’s 
investigation is still under way.

text:
“Working
 on major Trade Deal with the United Kingdom. Could be very big & 
exciting. JOBS! The E.U. is very protectionist with the U.S. STOP!”
analysis:
Britain
 and the United States cannot agree to any trade deal until Britain 
fully exits from the European Union, a process that will not be 
completed until March 2019.

text:
“Few,
 if any, Administrations have done more in just 7 months than the Trump 
A. Bills passed, regulations killed, border, military, ISIS, SC!”
analysis:
Trump,
 unlike many presidents in their 7th month, has signed no major 
legislation. at the time of the tweet, he had signed 55 bills, most of 
which were minor. Just among recent presidents, Jimmy Carter, George 
H.W. Bush and Bill Clinton had signed more bills than Trump at this 
point in their presidencies.

text:
“The
 issue of kneeling has nothing to do with race. It is about respect for 
our Country, Flag and National Anthem. NFL must respect this!”
analysis:
NFL
 players who decided to kneel during the anthem prior to the game said 
it was an act of protest against police brutality of black Americans.

text:
“...This
 now allows for the passage of large scale Tax Cuts (and Reform), which 
will be the biggest in the history of our country!”
analysis:
Trump’s
 tax cut would be nearly 0.9 percent of the gross domestic product, 
meaning it would be far smaller than President Ronald Reagan’s tax cut 
in 1981, which was 2.89 percent of GDP. Trump’s tax cut, if enacted in 
law, would be the eighth largest tax cut — and even smaller than two tax
 cuts passed under Barack Obama. Fact Checker rating:

text:
“The
 race for DNC Chairman was, of course, totally 'rigged.' Bernie's guy, 
like Bernie himself, never had a chance. Clinton demanded Perez!”
analysis:
Trump
 cites no evidence that the battle for Democratic National Committee 
chair, won narrowly by former Labor Secretary Tom Perez, was rigged. 
Indeed, there is no evidence and Sen. Bernie Sanders (D-Vt.), who backed
 Rep. Keith Ellison (D-Minn.), rejected Trump's claim. "No, he doesn't 
have a point," Sanders said when asked about the tweet.

text:
“Russia
 talk is FAKE NEWS put out by the Dems, and played up by the media, in 
order to mask the big election defeat and the illegal leaks!”
analysis:
Trump
 is falsely labeling nonpartisan investigations as "fake news" hyped by 
Democrats. The CIA concluded in 2016 that Russia intervened in the U.S. 
presidential election to help elect Trump, an assessment backed up by 
FBI Director James B. Comey and then-Director of National Intelligence 
James R. Clapper Jr. On Jan. 6, the intelligence community released a 
declassified report expressing "high confidence" in this judgement. 
Senate and House committees led by Republicans have begun their own 
investigations, and at least one Republican lawmaker has called for the 
appointment of a special prosecutor.

text:
“First
 the Ninth Circuit rules against the ban & now it hits again on 
sanctuary cities-both ridiculous rulings. See you in the Supreme Court!”
analysis:
The
 ruling blocking Trump's executive order on santuary cities was issued 
by a U.S. district court judge in San Francisco. It had not yet been 
taken up by an appeals court.

text:
“The
 U.S. recorded its slowest economic growth in five years (2016). GDP up 
only 1.6%. Trade deficits hurt the economy very badly.”
analysis:
A
 trade deficit can reduce the gross domestic product, as the balance of 
trade is part of the GDP formula. But Trump greatly overstates the 
impact on economic growth. The United States has been running trade 
deficits for three decades, both when GDP growth was high and when it 
was low.

text:
“Out
 of our very big country, with many choices, does everyone notice that 
both the 'ban' case and now the 'sanctuary' case is brought in the Ninth
 Circuit, which has a terrible record of being overturned (close to 
80%). They used to call this 'judge shopping!' Messy system.”
analysis:
San
 Francisco and Santa Clara County, the governments that sued over 
Trump's sanctuary order, are in California. So that's where they would 
need to file a lawsuit. They also did not get to choose the judge that 
ruled against Trump. We have earlier explored the claim about the Ninth 
Circuit being overturned 80 percent. The Ninth Circuit is not the most 
overturned court by the annual reversal rate. It does have a high raw 
number of reversals or number of cases on the Supreme Court docket. But 
it also reviews more cases than other circuits, is larger than other 
circuits and terminates far more cases than other circuits.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Just
 arrived in Italy for the G7. Trip has been very successful. We made and
 saved the USA many billions of dollars and millions of jobs.”
analysis:
Trump
 signed trade and jobs agreements that might lead to job creation in the
 U.S., but he's counting his chickens before they hatch. As for the 
number of jobs, thousands appears to have morphed into millions. But an 
{analysis published by The Washington Post} reported that the U.S. 
companies involved would not confirm any specific number of jobs saved 
or supported, suggesting that Trump’s original estimate of “thousands” 
was more guesswork than reality. Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Why
 didn't A.G. Sessions replace Acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe, a Comey
 friend who was in charge of Clinton investigation but got big dollars 
($700,000) for his wife's political run from Hillary Clinton and her 
representatives. Drain the Swamp!”
analysis:
Andrew
 McCabe, who is now the acting FBI director, became part of the 
investigation of Hillary Clinton’s emails long after his wife, Jill 
McCabe, unsuccessfully ran for a Virginia Senate seat. The political 
action committee of Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe (D) gave $452,500 to 
McCabe, and the state Democratic Party gave her campaign an additional 
$207,788. That was about one-third of the $1.8 million budget for her 
campaign. McAuliffe is close to Clinton, but there is no evidence she 
knew of the contributions. Moreover, it stretches the imagination that 
McAuliffe would know that the husband of someone he was supporting in a 
Virginia legislative race was going to be promoted months later to a 
position of authority in the email case.

text: “Thank you Foxconn, for investing $10 BILLION DOLLARS with the potential for up to 13K new jobs in Wisconsin! MadeInTheUSA”
analysis:
Trump
 touted Foxconn's investment announcement, but the company considered 
investing in U.S.-based facilities since 2014, though its initial plans 
to invest in Pennsylvania didn't pan out. Moreover, the $3 billion 
incentives package offered by Wisconsin to lure Foxconn has not yet been
 approved by the Wisconsin Senate, amid concerns that the state would 
use taxpayer money for a project that would not generate profit for 
Wisconsin until 2042. Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Ratings
 for NFL football are way down except before game starts, when people 
tune in to see whether or not our country will be disrespected!”
analysis:
This
 lacks context. The TV audience size for NFL games is down this year, 
but it’s unclear exactly why, and there is no direct connection to the 
protests. “Average attendance at regular season NFL games last year was 
the highest since 2007, when the NFL set an all-time record in 
attendance. The NFL says ticket sales are “on par” with last year,” 
according to the {Associated Press.} And professional football games 
remain among the most-watched televised events, the AP reported.

text:
“But
 while Dallas dropped to its knees as a team, they all stood up for our 
National Anthem. Big progress being made-we all love our country!”
analysis:
The
 Dallas Cowboys said their act of kneeling and then standing was a 
direct response to Trump's attacks on players kneeling, and a "statement
 for equality and as a representation of unity. According to {The 
Washington Post}: "The Cowboys “tossed around ideas” and sought a 
solution that promoted unity while satisfying both the group of players 
who wanted to kneel for the anthem and the group that wanted to stand. 
Once the compromise was reached, members of the Cowboys’ ownership group
 discussed the plan with representatives of the Cardinals’ ownership, 
the person with knowledge of the planning said."

text:
“Why
 isn't the House Intelligence Committee looking into the Bill & 
Hillary deal that allowed big Uranium to go to Russia, Russian 
speech....”
analysis:
Trump
 repeats a Four Pinocchio claim he used during the campaign. It wasn't a
 "Bill & Hillary deal"; the State Department was one of nine 
agencies on a committee that approved the sale of majority of shares of a
 uranium mining company to the Russians. The Nuclear Regulatory 
Commission also separately approved the deal. There's no evidence 
Clinton got involved in the deal personally, and it's highly 
questionable this deal even rose to the level of the secretary of state.Fact Checker rating:

text: “Democrats jeopardizing the safety of our troops to bail out their donors from insurance companies.”
analysis:
Trump
 suggests insurance companies are major backers of Democrats, but 
opensecrets.org says that 68 percent of insurance company contributions 
go to Republicans.

text:
“So
 they caught Fake News CNN cold, but what about NBC, CBS & ABC? What
 about the failing @nytimes & @washingtonpost? They are all Fake 
News!”
analysis:
Both
 the Times and The Post have seen spikes in audience and subscribers in 
2017. (The Post announced at the end of 2016 that it is “profitable and 
growing.”) Moreover, unlike the creators of actual fake news, the 
editors of the retracted CNN article have resigned and been held to 
account.

text:
“Fake
 News CNN is looking at big management changes now that they got caught 
falsely pushing their phony Russian stories. Ratings way down!”
analysis:
This
 is false. Data from Nielsen shows CNN is at a five-year high in total 
viewers for primetime, total day, and those two categories for 25- to 
54-year-olds.

text: “Big progress being made in ridding our country of MS-13 gang members and gang members in general. MAKE AMERICA SAFE AGAIN!”
analysis:
This
 is an exaggeration. Earlier this year, Immigration and Customs 
Enforcement conducted the largest gang surge to date. While about 1,000 
gang members or affiliates were arrested, they were not yet deported out
 of the country as of June 2017. Moreover, just 104 were associated with
 MS-13. Still, there has been an increase in the rate of gang 
deportations in general to El Salvador (where MS-13 gang’s roots are) 
and Salvadoran officials are preparing for more.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“With
 Mexico being one of the highest crime Nations in the world, we must 
have THE WALL. Mexico will pay for it through reimbursement/other.”
analysis:
A
 {leaked transcript} of Trump's phone call with Mexican President 
Enrique Pena Nieto shows Trump knows Mexico will not pay for the wall. 
Trump told Pena Nieto: "I am willing to say that we will work it out, 
but that means it will come out in the wash and that is okay. But you 
cannot say anymore that the United States is going to pay for the wall."

text:
“With
 one Yes vote in hospital & very positive signs from Alaska and two 
others (McCain is out), we have the HCare Vote, but not for Friday!”
analysis:
This
 is false. Sen. Thad Cochran (R-Miss.) was at home in Mississippi 
recovering from urological issue but he was not hospitalized. He missed 
the health care vote, but the Graham-Cassidy health bill failed even 
without Cochran's vote.

text:
“We
 will have the votes for Healthcare but not for the reconciliation 
deadline of Friday, after which we need 60. Get rid of Filibuster Rule!”
analysis:
The
 Senate was already working through the reconciliation process, which 
requires a 51-vote majority, to pass the Obamacare repeal and replace 
bill.

text:
“Facebook
 was always anti-Trump.The Networks were always anti-Trump hence,Fake 
News, @nytimes(apologized) & @WaPo were anti-Trump. Collusion?”
analysis: The New York Times did not apologize to its subscribers for its coverage of Trump.

text:
“..But
 the people were Pro-Trump! Virtually no President has accomplished what
 we have accomplished in the first 9 months-and economy roaring”
analysis:
Trump
 has no major legislative achievements to his credit and has signed 
fewer bills than many recent presidents. The economy was already doing 
well when he became president.

text: “It is now commonly agreed, after many months of COSTLY looking, that there was NO collusion between Russia and Trump.”
analysis: The congressional investigating committees say they have reached no conclusion on collusion.

text:
“Thr
 coverage about me in the @nytimes and the @washingtonpost gas been so 
false and angry that the times actually apologized to its..... 
...dwindling subscribers and readers.They got me wrong right from the 
beginning and still have not changed course, and never will. DISHONEST”
analysis:
The
 New York Times did not apologize to its subscribers for its coverage of
 Trump. Both the Times and The Post have seen spikes in audience and 
subscribers. (The Post announced at the end of 2016 that it is 
“profitable and growing.”)

text:
“Big
 announcement by Ford today. Major investment to be made in three 
Michigan plants. Car companies coming back to U.S.  JOBS! JOBS! JOBS!”
analysis:
The
 investment projects announced later that day were in line with the 
contract Ford negotiated with the United Auto Workers in 2015.

Trump
 repeats a Four Pinocchio claim he used during the campaign. It wasn't a
 "Bill & Hillary deal"; the State Department was one of nine 
agencies on a committee that approved the sale of majority of shares of a
 uranium mining company to the Russians. The Nuclear Regulatory 
Commission also separately approved the deal. There's no evidence 
Clinton got involved in the deal personally, and it's highly 
questionable this deal even rose to the level of the secretary of state.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“I
 suggest that we add more dollars to Healthcare and make it the best 
anywhere. ObamaCare is dead - the Republicans will do much better!”
analysis:
The
 Affordable Care Act is not dead and is expected to remain stable for 
the foreseeable future, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

text:
“The
 massive TAX CUTS/REFORM that I have submitted is moving along in the 
process very well, actually ahead of schedule. Big benefits to all!”
analysis:
The
 White House release a one-page outline about its tax policy proposals, 
but there is no tax bill that is "moving along in the process very 
well."

text: “Democrats purposely misstated Medicaid under new Senate bill — actually goes up.”
analysis:
This
 is quite misleading. He describes the raw increase in Medicaid spending
 under the Senate bill. That is just one part of the picture that omits 
the fact that if the Senate bill as written by the date of his tweet 
becomes law, federal spending would be reduced by $772 billion over 10 
years, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. 
Moreover, 15 million fewer people would be enrolled in the program over 
10 years than would be under current law. Fact Checker rating:

text:
“The
 #AmazonWashingtonPost, sometimes referred to as the guardian of Amazon 
not paying internet taxes (which they should) is FAKE NEWS!”
analysis: There is no "internet tax." If Trump is referring to sales taxes, the company does collect sales taxes.

text:
“If
 Republicans are going to pass great future legislation in the Senate, 
they must immediately go to a 51 vote majority, not senseless 60...Even 
though parts of healthcare could pass at 51, some really good things 
need 60. So many great future bills & budgets need 60 votes”
analysis:
The
 Senate was already working through the reconciliation process, which 
requires a 51-vote majority, to pass the Obamacare repeal and replace 
bill.

text:
“GDP
 was revised upward to 3.1 for last quarter. Many people thought it 
would be years before that happened. We have just begun!”
analysis:
This
 is wrong. Quarterly GDP growth topped 3 percent often in Barack Obama's
 presidency, mostly recently 2015. Trump has pledged 4 percent annual 
growth, which most economists think is unlikely.

text:
“Puerto
 Rico is devastated. Phone system, electric grid many roads, gone. FEMA 
and First Responders are amazing. Governor said 'great job!'”
analysis:
Not
 exactly. Puerto Rico Gov. Ricardo Rosselló said the federal government 
has "complied with our petitions in an expedited manner," but "we need 
to do a lot more in order for us to get out of the emergency."

text: “JFK Files are released, long ahead of schedule!”
analysis:
A
 law signed by President George H.W. Bush in 1992 mandated that all 
records be released by Oct. 26, 2017. So the release was not ahead of 
schedule -- and many are still secret.

text:
“While
 not at all presidential I must point out that the Sloppy Michael Moore 
Show on Broadway was a TOTAL BOMB and was forced to close. Sad!”
analysis: Actually, the show had a 12-week limited engagement and closed on time.

text:
“Remember
 when the failing @nytimes apologized to its subscribers, right after 
the election, because their coverage was so wrong. Now worse!”
analysis: The New York Times did not apologize to its subscribers for its coverage of Trump.

text:
“Our
 new American Energy Policy will unlock MILLIONS of jobs & TRILLIONS
 in wealth. We are on the cusp of a true energy REVOLUTION.”
analysis:
Trump's
 soon-to-arrive revolutionary policy is one that most experts don't 
forsee. {Led by the hydraulic fracturing techniques, the United States 
and the rest of the world have been in the midst of an energy 
revolution, but that began nearly 15 years ago.}

text:
“If
 a new HealthCare Bill is not approved quickly, BAILOUTS for Insurance 
Companies and BAILOUTS for Members of Congress will end very soon!”
analysis:
President
 Trump is misusing the term “bailout.” Insurance companies don’t make 
money through cost-sharing — they are being paid back for money they’ve 
already spent on behalf of people who purchased their health plans. 
Members of Congress also did not get "bailouts" when they were moved 
onto the Obamacare exchanges. The president either doesn’t understand 
the process or is being purposely misleading.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“In
 other words, Russia was against Trump in the 2016 Election - and why 
not, I want strong military & low oil prices. Witch Hunt! (Retweeted
 @foxandfriends Firm behind anti-Trump dossier also worked for Russia, 
Senate witness says)”
analysis:
The
 information on Russian efforts to sway the 2016 election was developed 
by the intelligence community and published in a declassified report, in
 which the agencies said they had "high confidence" it was correct.

text: “U.S. Stock Market up almost 20% since Election!”
analysis:
This
 is a flip-flop for Trump. Trump equates the rise of the stock market 
since the election as a demonstration of a good economy. But the stock 
market had already been rising for years before he was elected — and he 
called it “a big, fat, ugly bubble.”

text:
“The
 very outdated filibuster rule must go. Budget reconciliation is killing
 R's in Senate. Mitch M, go to 51 Votes NOW and WIN. IT'S TIME!”
analysis:
The
 Senate was already working through the reconciliation process, which 
requires a 51-vote majority, to pass the Obamacare repeal and replace 
bill.

text:
“Republicans
 in the Senate will NEVER win if they don't go to a 51 vote majority 
NOW. They look like fools and are just wasting time......”
analysis:
The
 Senate was already working through the reconciliation process, which 
requires a 51-vote majority, to pass the Obamacare repeal and replace 
bill.

text: “All of this 'Russia' talk right when the Republicans are making their big push for historic Tax Cuts & Reform.”
analysis:
Trump’s
 tax cut would be nearly 0.9 percent of the gross domestic product, 
meaning it would be far smaller than President Ronald Reagan’s tax cut 
in 1981, which was 2.89 percent of GDP. Trump’s tax cut, if enacted in 
law, would be the eighth largest tax cut — and even smaller than two tax
 cuts passed under Barack Obama.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“Only
 109 people out of 325,000 were detained and held for questioning. Big 
problems at airports were caused by Delta computer outage,..... 
protesters and the tears of Senator Schumer. Secretary Kelly said that 
all is going well with very few problems. MAKE AMERICA SAFE AGAIN!”
analysis:
The
 Trump White House’s figures on the scope of the travel ban were 
ludicrously low. The universe of people likely affected by the travel 
suspension was around 60,000, according to the State Department  — not 
109. The White House later admitted the 109 figure reflected only the 
number of people who were affected by the ban and were in-flight at the 
time the order was signed.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“If
 the ban were announced with a one week notice, the 'bad' would rush 
into our country during that week. A lot of bad 'dudes' out there!”
analysis:
It
 typically takes weeks or months to get a tourist visa to enter the 
United States. It certainly would take months for “bad guys,” presumably
 with records that would take longer for background checks, to receive a
 tourist visa.

text: “The failing @nytimes has disgraced the media world. Gotten me wrong for two solid years. Change libel laws?”
analysis:
The
 Times, like The Post, has seen spikes in audience and subscribers. 
Moreover, the day that Trump announced House Speaker Paul Ryan would be 
pulling the Obamacare replacement bill, Trump personally called two 
reporters before speaking publicly: Robert Costa from The Post, and 
Maggie Haberman from the Times.

text: “Dems want billions to go to Insurance Companies to bail out donors.”
analysis:
About
 two-thirds of donations made by insurance companies go to Republicans, 
not Democrats, according to campaign finance records. Moreover, the 
funds advanced in Obamacare go to help low-income voters afford health 
insurance.

text:
“We
 have a MASSIVE trade deficit with Germany, plus they pay FAR LESS than 
they should on NATO & military. Very bad for U.S. This will change”
analysis:
Long
 before Trump became president, NATO had set a guideline of each member 
spending at least 2 percent of gross domestic product on defense -- by 
2024. Direct spending for NATO is governed by a formula based on each 
nation's gross national income — the total domestic and foreign output 
claimed by residents of a country. With the largest economy in NATO, the
 United States pays the largest share — about 22 percent. Germany is 
second, with about 15 percent.Fact Checker rating:

text:
“The
 U.S. Senate should switch to 51 votes, immediately, and get Healthcare 
and TAX CUTS approved, fast and easy. Dems would do it, no doubt!”
analysis:
Both
 items Trump references in this tweet would be done through the 
reconciliation process, a parliamentary procedure that only requires 51 
votes.

text:
“Watched
 low rated @Morning_Joe for first time in long time. FAKE NEWS. He 
called me to stop a National Enquirer article. I said no! Bad show”
analysis:
Joe
 Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski dispute this account. They {wrote in an
 op-ed in The Washington Post}: "This year, top White House staff 
members warned that the National Enquirer was planning to publish a 
negative article about us unless we begged the president to have the 
story spiked. We ignored their desperate pleas."

text:
“Don't
 give up Republican Senators, the World is watching: Repeal & 
Replace...and go to 51 votes (nuke option), get Cross State Lines & 
more.
analysis:
The
 Senate was already working through the reconciliation process, which 
requires a 51-vote majority, to pass the Obamacare repeal and replace 
bill.

text:
“After
 witnessing first hand the horror & devastation caused by Hurricane 
Harvey,my heart goes out even more so to the great people of Texas!”
analysis: He got briefed by state and local officials about the situation on the ground -- the definition of second-hand.

text: “The U.S. has been talking to North Korea, and paying them extortion money, for 25 years. Talking is not the answer!”
analysis:
The
 United States {stopped paying assistance} to North Korea after 2011, 
with the exception of $1 million in humanitarian aid in January 2017 
that was negotiated by outgoing Secretary of State John Kerry just 
before Trump was inaugurated.

text:
“In
 analyzing the Alabama Primary race,FAKE NEWS always fails to mention 
that the candidate I endorsed went up MANY points after endorsement!”
analysis: Polling does not support Trump's claim that Luther Strange's chances improved after Trump's endorsement, {PolitiFact found.}

text: “Sorry, but this is years ago, before Paul Manafort was part of the Trump campaign.”
analysis:
The
 indictment brought against Manafort, Trump's former campaign chairman, 
indicates illegal activity took place before, during and after 
Manafort's stint as Trump campaign chairman.

text: “Report out that Obama Campaign paid $972,000 to Fusion GPS. The firm also got $12,400,000 (really?) from DNC!”
analysis:
Trump
 gets this completely mixed up. Perkins Coie, a law firm that worked for
 both the Democratic National Committee and the Clinton campaign, hired 
Fusion GPS. The Obama campaign also hired Perkins Coie. But that did not
 translate into all funding for the law firm equaling funds for Fusion 
GPS -- or that the Obama campaign had any connection to Fusion.

text:
“If
 ObamaCare is hurting people, & it is, why shouldn’t it hurt the 
insurance companies & why should Congress not be paying what public 
pays?”
analysis:
Members
 of Congress and most staff get health insurance via Obamacare, as they 
were kicked off the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program when the 
law was implemented. Consistent with the FEHBP, the federal government 
pays about 70 percent of the cost of premiums.

text:
“Highest
 Stock Market EVER, best economic numbers in years, unemployment lowest 
in 17 years, wages raising, border secure, S.C.: No WH chaos!”
analysis:
This
 is a flip-flop for Trump. Trump equates the rise of the stock market 
since the election as a demonstration of a good economy. But the stock 
market had already been rising for years before he was elected — and he 
called it “a big, fat, ugly bubble.” He also previously dismissed jobs 
numbers as a phony statistic.
